titles.title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to increase the maximum age up to which an individual may be afforded health coverage under chapter 89 of such title as a dependent child.
To amend title 5, United States Code, to increase the maximum age up to which an individual may be afforded health coverage under chapter 89 of such title as a dependent child.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.

bill.summary: Increases, from 22 to 30, the maximum age up to which an individual may be afforded health coverage under the Federal Employees Health Benefits Program as a dependent child.
